summary: This document is T-Mobile USA's response to a federal subpoena (dated February 16, 2007) for customer account information and call detail records for Jeffrey E. Epstein. It provides his account details and extensive call logs from February to June 2005, showing calls to/from locations including New York, Miami, West Palm Beach, and international numbers. This document is a series of detailed cellular phone billing statements from T-Mobile, covering the period from May to October 2005. It itemizes call logs, data usage, messaging, and roaming charges, showing frequent activity between New York, NY; Miami, FL; West Palm Beach, FL; and other locations, with some international calls. The account is associated with a BlackBerry device. This document is a T-Mobile USA response to an FBI subpoena dated February 16, 2007, providing subscriber information and call detail records for a mobile number. It includes itemized billing statements from August 2005 through February 2006, showing calls, data usage, and roaming charges, primarily to/from New York, NY, Miami, FL, and other locations. The subscriber account was established in November 2004 and cancelled in December 2004.

persons.name: Jeffrey E Epstein
persons.context: The subscriber whose account information and call detail records were subpoenaed by the FBI. The document provides his personal details and extensive phone records.

persons.name: Ronald Witt
persons.role: T-Mobile USA Law Enforcement Relations representative
persons.context: Signed the response letter to the FBI subpoena, providing the subscriber records.

events.title: Subpoena Issued for Epstein's Phone Records
events.description: A federal subpoena pursuant to 18 U.S.C. 876 was issued, requesting customer identification and call detail records for Jeffrey Epstein's T-Mobile phone number.

events.title: T-Mobile Responds to Subpoena
events.description: T-Mobile USA Law Enforcement Relations provided the requested account information and call detail records for Jeffrey Epstein's phone to the FBI in West Palm Beach, FL.

events.title: Epstein's T-Mobile Account Established
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's T-Mobile account was activated. The service was later cancelled on April 18, 2006.

events.title: FBI Subpoena Issued
events.description: The FBI issued a subpoena pursuant to 18 U.S.C. 876 for customer identification and call detail records for a specific T-Mobile mobile number.

events.title: T-Mobile Response to Subpoena
events.description: T-Mobile USA, via Ronald Witt, responded to the FBI subpoena, providing the requested subscriber account information and call detail records.

events.title: Account Established
events.description: The T-Mobile subscriber account was established.

events.title: Account Cancelled
events.description: The T-Mobile subscriber account was cancelled.

keyFacts: The FBI subpoenaed Jeffrey Epstein's T-Mobile phone records in February 2007 as part of an investigation.
Epstein's T-Mobile account was active from February 8, 2005, to April 18, 2006, and was billed to his New York address (NY 10022-6843).
The call logs show frequent communication between New York, NY; Miami, FL; and West Palm Beach, FL, from February to June 2005.
International calls and text messages were made, including to Poland and the Virgin Islands.
The phone was a Blackberry device used for data services, indicating email/internet usage.
The document contains detailed cellular billing records from May to October 2005, showing extensive phone and data activity.
Call logs indicate frequent travel and communication between key Epstein-associated locations: New York City, Miami, and West Palm Beach.
The account was for a BlackBerry device (RIM Blackberry) with regular data usage, suggesting business or personal communication.
International calls and roaming charges are present, including calls to Lithuania and activity in the British Virgin Islands.
The records show a pattern of incoming calls from blocked or unavailable numbers, alongside calls to directory assistance (411).
The FBI subpoenaed T-Mobile for subscriber and call detail records for a specific mobile number in February 2007.
The subscriber account was established on November 30, 2004, and cancelled on December 9, 2004, but detailed billing records from August 2005 to February 2006 were provided.
Call records show frequent activity to/from New York, NY, and Miami, FL, with roaming charges from the British Virgin Islands in October 2005.
The account was associated with a RIM Blackberry device, showing consistent data usage.
The response letter is signed by Ronald Witt of T-Mobile USA Law Enforcement Relations, indicating formal law enforcement cooperation.
